Spyral¶

What is spyral?¶

spyral is a 2D game engine/framework built on top of pygame. Its purpose is to rapid prototyping and development of efficient games. It started as a project to allow easy optimization of games for the OLPC XO, and has evolved into a semi-complete but still evolving framework for developing games.

Getting started¶

To get spyral, you can clone the git repository, or download packages, from the github site. For now, you can simply include the spyral directory in your project. A setup.py will be included at a later date. For a barebones example, see spyral/examples/skel.py, which provides a skeleton example of a program, complete with comments.

class spyral.sprite.Sprite(*groups)[source]¶

Analagous to Sprite in pygame, but automatically handles dirty updates, and supports adding self.layer to allow layered rendering. This means that if the Sprite is repositioned or killed, the game background will automatically redraw over the sprite. These sprites support one additional feature, setting Sprite.position will automatically set Sprite.rect to a rect starting from position with the size of the image, and accessing Sprite.position will return the top left coordinate of Sprite.rect

alive()[source]¶

Return True if this sprite belongs to any groups, false otherwise

groups()[source]¶

Return a list of groups that this sprite belongs to.

kill()[source]¶
